Sweet and Spicy Mango Glazed Salmon

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking to elevate your dinner game with a dish that's bursting with flavor, look no further than this Sweet and Spicy Mango Glazed Salmon. This recipe is a perfect harmony of sweet mango puree and spicy sriracha, combined with the umami richness of soy sauce and the natural sweetness of honey. Not only is it incredibly easy to prepare, but it also delivers a delightful punch that will impress your family and guests alike. Salmon is not only delicious but also packed with nutrients and omega-3 fatty acids, making this dish a healthy choice for any meal. Whether you're hosting a special occasion or simply enjoying a weeknight dinner, this vibrant and colorful salmon dish will surely become a favorite in your household. So, roll up your sleeves and get ready to savor the unparalleled combination of flavors that this Sweet and Spicy Mango Glazed Salmon has to offer!

Ingredients

salmon fillets

Choose fresh, high-quality salmon for the best flavor; look for bright, shiny skin and a firm texture. If you can't find salmon, you can substitute with other fatty fish like trout or mackerel. For a non-fish alternative, try chicken breasts, adjusting the cooking time as needed.

mango puree

Fresh mangoes can be blended to make your own puree; just peel, pit, and blend until smooth. If fresh mangoes aren't available, you can use canned mango puree or frozen mango that has been thawed and blended. For an extra flavor boost, consider adding a pinch of chili powder to the puree.

soy sauce

Use low-sodium soy sauce to control the saltiness of the dish. If you're looking for gluten-free options, tamari is a great substitute. For a different flavor profile, consider using coconut aminos or liquid aminos.

honey

If you're looking for a vegan option, maple syrup or agave nectar can be used in place of honey. To enhance the flavor, you can also try using infused honey, such as ginger or chili-infused honey.

sriracha

Feel free to adjust the amount of sriracha based on your heat preference. If sriracha isn’t available, you can substitute with another hot sauce or a homemade chili paste. For a milder flavor, consider using a sweet chili sauce instead.

lime juice

Fresh lime juice is best for maximum flavor; however, bottled lime juice can be used in a pinch. For a twist, you can also substitute with lemon juice or even orange juice for a sweeter glaze.

salt

Always taste your glaze before adding salt, as soy sauce can be salty on its own. If you're watching your sodium intake, consider using herbs and spices instead to enhance flavor without adding salt.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper adds a stronger flavor than pre-ground. If you want a different flavor profile, try adding crushed red pepper flakes or a pinch of cayenne for extra heat.

fresh cilantro

Cilantro adds a fresh, bright flavor; however, if you’re not a fan, you can substitute with parsley or basil. For a more intense flavor, consider using cilantro stems in the glaze as well.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Begin by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C). This step is crucial as it ensures that your salmon cooks evenly and develops a nice glaze.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Mango Glaze

    In a small bowl, mix together the mango puree, soy sauce, honey, sriracha, lime juice, salt, and black pepper. Whisk until fully combined. This glaze balances sweetness and heat, making it perfect for salmon.

  • Step 3: Arrange Salmon on Baking Sheet

    Place the salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. This prevents the fish from sticking and makes cleanup easier. Ensure that the fillets are spaced apart for even cooking.

  • Step 4: Glaze the Salmon

    Using a brush or spoon, generously apply the mango glaze over each salmon fillet. Make sure to coat them well to maximize flavor.

  • Step 5: Bake the Salmon

    Bake in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes. The salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork. Cooking time may vary depending on the thickness of the fillets.

  • Step 6: Garnish and Serve

    Once baked, remove the salmon from the oven and garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve immediately, perhaps alongside rice or a fresh salad for a complete meal.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare salmon fillets before cooking?

Start by rinsing the salmon under cold water and patting them dry with paper towels. This helps remove any excess moisture. If there are any pin bones, use tweezers to remove them carefully.

What is mango puree and how can I make it?

Mango puree is simply blended mango. To make it, peel and chop ripe mangoes, then blend them in a food processor until smooth. You can also use store-bought mango puree if you prefer.

How do I know when the salmon is cooked?

Salmon is done when it flakes easily with a fork and has an internal temperature of 145°F (63°C). Keep an eye on it to avoid overcooking.

What can I use instead of sriracha for a different flavor?

If you want to substitute sriracha, you can use any hot sauce you like, or even a pinch of red pepper flakes for a milder spice.

Can I make the glaze ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the mango glaze in advance and store it in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. Just give it a stir before using.

How can I tell if my oven is at the right temperature?

Using an oven thermometer is the best way to ensure your oven is preheated accurately. If you don’t have one, let the oven preheat for at least 20 minutes before baking.

What should I serve with this salmon dish?

This salmon pairs well with a side of rice, quinoa, or steamed vegetables. You can also serve it with a fresh salad for a lighter option.

How can I safely handle raw fish?

Always wash your hands with soap and water before and after handling raw fish. Use separate cutting boards and utensils for raw fish and other ingredients to prevent cross-contamination.

What is the best way to store leftover salmon?

Place leftover salmon in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 2 days. You can also freeze it for longer storage, but it’s best to consume it fresh.

How do I chop fresh cilantro correctly?

To chop cilantro, rinse it under cold water to remove dirt, then dry it. Remove the thick stems and gather the leaves into a pile. Use a sharp knife to chop finely. You can also use kitchen scissors for a quicker option.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is naturally gluten-free, but ensure the soy sauce is gluten-free if necessary. For a lower sugar alternative, consider using agave syrup or a sugar-free honey substitute. For a vegan version, replace salmon with grilled tofu or tempeh, coating it with the same mango glaze for a delicious plant-based option. Additionally, ensure that the honey used is suitable for vegans, or substitute it with maple syrup.

Pairings

Serve the Sweet and Spicy Mango Glazed Salmon with coconut rice or quinoa for a delightful contrast in texture. For a vegetable side, consider grilled asparagus or sautéed bok choy, which pair well with the glaze's tropical notes. For a beverage, a chilled Sauvignon Blanc or a light, fruity Riesling complements the salmon's sweetness and spice. If you prefer a non-alcoholic option, a mango mojito or sparkling water with lime will enhance the meal without overpowering the flavors.

Serving Suggestions

Present the salmon on a large platter, garnished with additional fresh cilantro and thin lime wedges for a vibrant touch. Drizzle any remaining mango glaze over the salmon before serving to enhance the visual appeal. Consider serving the dish family-style with the sides arranged around the salmon, allowing guests to help themselves. For an elegant touch, serve on individual plates with a sprinkle of sesame seeds for added texture.

Sweet and Spicy Mango Glazed Salmon

25 min
$15.99
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

fish

Dietary Tags:

gluten-freehigh-protein

Cuisine:

Course:

main coursedinner

Tags:

easyquickhealthy

Description

A delightful blend of sweet mango and spicy flavors that make salmon irresistibly delicious!

Ingredients

  • salmon fillets: 4 (6 oz)
  • mango puree: 1 cup
  • soy sauce: 2 tablespoons
  • honey: 2 tablespoons
  • sriracha: 1 tablespoon
  • lime juice: 1 tablespoon
  • salt: to taste
  • black pepper: to taste
  • fresh cilantro: for garnish

Date Created:

11/18/2024
